overview: Grants to help with the cost of installing renewable energy technology in your home, eg solar panels, heat pumps, biomass boilers
title: Renewable Heat Premium Payment

table.body:
You could get money to help with the cost of installing renewable heating technologies in your home. For example: 

+ solar thermal panels - £300
+ heat pumps - up to £1250
+ biomass boilers - £950

The money is paid through the Renewable Heat Premium Payment scheme. 

The money doesn't have to be paid back but you may have to agree to give information about your energy usage. For example, through a survey or having a meter installed. 

@ The money you can get and how to apply is different if you're in [Northern Ireland](http://www.detini.gov.uk/deti-energy-index/northern_ireland_renewable_heat_premium_payment_scheme_.htm "Renewable Heat Premium Payment scheme Northern Ireland"). @
table.title: Overview

table.body:
How much you get depends on the type of heating system you're installing. 

Heating system | Grant
- | -  
Solar thermal hot water | £300 
Air-to-water heat pump | £850 
Ground-source or water-source heat pump | £1,250 
Biomass boiler | £950 

The money doesn't have to be paid back. 

If you live in Scotland you can also apply for an [interest-free loan.](http://www.energysavingtrust.org.uk/scotland/Take-action/Grants-and-Discounts-Database/Home-renewables-loan-scheme "Home renewables loan scheme"){:rel="external"} (up to £10,000). 

##How the money is paid

If you qualify, you'll be sent a voucher confirming how much money you'll get. The money is paid to you when the system is [installed and certified]((/renewable-heat-premium-payment#how-to-claim "Exchange your voucher").
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
You can apply if:

+ you live in England, Scotland or Wales
+ you own the property or have permission from the owner to install the new system 
+ the property is your main home or is lived in for most of the year
+ the product and installer are approved 
+ the property already has basic energy efficiency measures (where possible) - eg loft insulation
+ you have [planning permission](/planning-permission/do-you-need-planning-permission "Do you need planning permission?") to install the new system (if necessary) 
+ the property's main heating system isn't mains gas (heat pumps and biomass boiler grants only) 
+ the new system will be the property's main source of heating (heat pumps and biomass boiler grants only) 

##Approved products and installers 

The product and installer must be approved by the Microgeneration Certification Scheme, Solar Keymark or their equivalents. To check their approved, contact the Energy Saving Trust.

table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
You have to [apply online](https://www.energysavingtrust.org.uk/scheme/view/rhpp "Renewable Heat Premium Payment Application"){:rel="external"} to the Energy Saving Trust. You'll need an email address.

You're sent a voucher confirming how much money you'll get - this can take 1 to 10 days to arrive. 

##How to get your payment 

After the installation is complete send the following to the Energy Saving Trust: 

+ the completed voucher
+ a copy of your installer's invoice(s)
+ a copy of your microgeneration certificate - your installer will give you this
+ a checklist filled out by the installer (heat pumps only)

You'll be paid the money into the account you put on your application form. 

$D [Download ‘Heat pump checklist’ (PDF, 820KB)](http://www.energysavingtrust.org.uk/content/download/77494/930537/file/RHPP2%20Installer%20checklist%20with%20trained%20installers%20FINAL.pdf "Download ‘Renewable Heat Premium Payment (RHPP) Installer Checklist’ (PDF, 820KB)"){:rel="external"} $D

% The voucher has an expiry date - you must exchange it by this date or you won't get any money. %

##When are you paid

Payments are usually made within 31 workings days. Payments can be paid in instalments if a meter is being installed. 

The Energy Savings Trust will let you know when you'll be paid.
